Ukkhā，（?） [can it be compared with Vedic ukṣan?] in ukkhasataṁ dānaṁ，given at various times of the day （meaning = e（katόmbh?） S．II，264 （v．l．ukkā）．Or is it to be read ukhāsataṁ d．i．e．consisting of 100 pots （of rice = mahā danaṁ?）．S A：paṇītabhojana-bharitānaṁ mahā-ukkhalinaṁ sataṁ dānaṁ．Cp．ukhā cooking vessel ThA．71 （Ap．V．38）．Kern，Toev．under ukkhā trsl．“zeker muntstuck”，i．e．kind of gift．（Page 125）
